results.content: Great and Understandable and to the point. Not a lot of fluff. Recommended for sure.
results.content_html: Great and Understandable and to the point. Not a lot of fluff. Recommended for sure.

results.content:
Great course! Watch the introduction, since it explains some of the prerequisites.
On one hand I like that the examples are simple and easy to follow, on the other hand it would be great if there were also some examples, that were a little more relevant for when coding frontend apps.
Even with my little 'gripe', I still full heartedly give this course 5 stars.
Great intro to functional programming.

results.content:
I give it five stars because it delivers on what's promised - functional programming elements in Javascript. Very concise, clearly explained... and that's it.

However, note that is a bit on the basic side of things. Don't expect anything more than you'd get out of the various tutorials you find online.
results.content_html:
I give it five stars because it delivers on what's promised - functional programming elements in Javascript. Very concise, clearly explained... and that's it.

However, note that is a bit on the basic side of things. Don't expect anything more than you'd get out of the various tutorials you find online.

results.content: This is an excellent course.  Greatly exceeded expectations.  The presenter is thoroughly prepared, professional, understandable, and engaged.  I hope he will offer more courses, perhaps continuing the topic by exploring Functional JavaScript libraries such as Ramda, Lodash, etc.  Very well done.  Highly recommended without reservation.
results.content_html: This is an excellent course. Greatly exceeded expectations. The presenter is thoroughly prepared, professional, understandable, and engaged. I hope he will offer more courses, perhaps continuing the topic by exploring Functional JavaScript libraries such as Ramda, Lodash, etc. Very well done. Highly recommended without reservation.

results.content:
The course itself is very good, but it's quite basic. 
I was looking for more advanced topics.
The examples are quite basic, no discussion on how to design and think in 'functional'.
You can do awesome stuff with functional, but no mentioning of that here. 
If you're an experienced developer, I wouldn't recommend this course. 
If you're fresh and/or suffer from spaghetti code, then this is a great starting point.

results.content: This is a nice refresher course. Thoroughly enjoyed it. The only negative would be that the examples were too simple. We could have had a bit more of complex and real world examples.
results.content_html: This is a nice refresher course. Thoroughly enjoyed it. The only negative would be that the examples were too simple. We could have had a bit more of complex and real world examples.

results.content: This course helps me understand more about the functional programming using JS with very detailed explanations.  Thanks the tutor.
results.content_html: This course helps me understand more about the functional programming using JS with very detailed explanations. Thanks the tutor.

results.content:
Though I have tried to learn functional programming for some time, I have been bogged down abstract explanations. Especially by the Jedish attitude of teachers.... This course, however, shows me surprisingly clear path to it. Especially, this course clarifies the pros and cons between traditional ways and functional approach, which helps me greately to grasph the essence.
With some exaggeration, this is a serendipity for me to enroll this course. Thank you so much. Oh, by the way, I would like to know my instructor's name to say 'Thank You'. 


Sincerely, Song
